posts.post_content: For those of you confused by the incomprehensible oracle, it simply means form blocking groups, then randomly determine which groups block which attacking creatures. The reason for the change is obvious: morph screws the whole thing up. That said, this is hysterical.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Another example of modern Magic wording making a card completely incomprehensable... like [Raging River](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Raging River). Plus, what happened to the face-down part? EDIT: Aah, "at random". See, I had to read the card 3 times to figure that out!

posts.post_content:
not really confusing at all, just means attackers can shuffle their creatures and put them face down, then after the enemy declares blockers you turn then face up.  
  
 If creatures without flying happen to block a flying creature, they don't get to block at all and your attacks go through.
posts.html:

If creatures without flying happen to block a flying creature, they don't get to block at all and your attacks go through.

Posted By: Hovercraft (3/23/2011 12:23:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
What makes it so confusing is that you can decide that two or more of your creatures are going to block together, whatever they end up blocking; and that every creature can be blocked, not by chance one creature gets blocked by two and one doesn't get blocked.   
  
I'm going to use this in my banding deck and blow some minds.
posts.html:
